sen.j: 錦小路通（にしきこうじどおり）は京都市の東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Nishikikoji-dori Street is one of the major east-west running streets in Kyoto City.
Nishikikoji-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.
Nishikikoji-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 平安京の錦小路にあたる。
sen.e: it corresponds to Nishikikoji of Heiankyo.
it corresponds to Nishikikoji of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Nishikikoji Street of Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 蛸薬師通と四条通の間を走る。
sen.e: It runs between the Takoyakushi-dori Street and the Shijo-dori Street.
It runs between Takoyakushi-dori Street and Shijo-dori Street.
It runs between Takoyakushi-dori Street and Shijo-dori Street.

sen.j: 東は新京極通の錦天満宮正面から西は壬生川通まで。
sen.e: It runs from the frontage of Nishiki Temmangu Shrine in the east to the Mibugawa-dori Street in the west.
It runs from the frontage of Nishiki Temmangu Shrine in the east to Mibugawa-dori Street in the west.
It runs from the frontage of Nishiki Tenmangu Shrine in the east to Mibugawa-dori Street in the west.

sen.j: 宇治拾遺物語の記述によると、平安時代は具足小路と呼ばれ、その後なまって、糞小路となり、勅命で四条通をはさんで南隣の綾小路通にちなんで錦小路に改められたという。
sen.e: According to Uji-shui monogatari (Uji-shui stories), its initial name in the Heian era, Ｇｕｓｏｋｕ-koji Street, corrupted into"Kuso-koji Street," and then, at imperial command, it was named "Nishikikoji" after the Ayanokoji-dori Street, which is the next street southwards across the Shijo-dori Street.

According to Uji-shui monogatari (Uji-shui stories), its initial name in the Heian era, Ｇｕｓｏｋｕ-koji Street, corrupted into "Kuso-koji Street," and then, at imperial command, it was named "Nishikikoji" after Ayanokoji-dori Street, which is the next street southwards across Shijo-dori Street.

According to Uji-shui monogatari (Uji-shui stories), its initial name in the Heian period, Gusoku-koji Street, was corrupted into Kuso-koji Street, and then, at imperial command, it was named Nishikikoji after Ayanokoji-dori Street, which is the next street southward across Shijo-dori Street.
sen.cmt: 二バイト文字修正 era→period

sen.j: 高倉通と寺町通間の錦市場は京の台所とよばれ、青果店、鮮魚店、乾物店、惣菜店などが並ぶアーケード、石畳の狭い通り。
sen.e: Kyoto Nishiki Food Market between the Takakura-dori Street and the Teramachi-dori Street is referred to as "Kyo (Capital) no daidokoro" (kitchen of Kyoto), whose narrow, stone paved street is lined with fruit and vegetable shops, fresh fish shops, grocers, and prepared meals shops.

Kyoto Nishiki Food Market, located between Takakura-dori Street and Teramachi-dori Street, is referred to as "Kyo (Capital) no daidokoro" (kitchen of Kyoto), whose narrow, stone-paved street is lined with fruit and vegetable shops, fresh fish shops, grocers and stores offering prepared meals.

Kyoto Nishiki Food Market, located between Takakura-dori Street and Teramachi-dori Street, is referred to as "Kyo (Capital) no daidokoro" (kitchen of Kyoto), whose narrow, stone-paved street is lined with fruit and vegetable shops, fresh fish shops, grocers and stores offering prepared meals.

sen.j: 新京極通から烏丸通までが路上喫煙等禁止区域である。
sen.e: The street between the Shinkyogoku-dori Street and the Karasuma-dori Street is a Public Nonsmoking Area.
The street between Shinkyogoku-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street is a Public Nonsmoking Area.
The street between Shinkyogoku-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street is a public nonsmoking area.
